abstract: John C. Bogle, the founder of Vanguard, says many institutional investors have failed to advocate on behalf of shareholders.
snippet: John C. Bogle, the founder of Vanguard, says many institutional investors have failed to advocate on behalf of shareholders.
lead_paragraph: EVERY once in a while, if only for sanity’s sake, it is wise to leave our bankrupt era behind and seek out a bit of wisdom from a moral authority. It’s a challenging exercise, given that so many formerly stellar reputations are now shipwrecked and that all those once-smart guys and gals have been reduced to bull-market geniuses.

headline.main: He Doesn’t Let Money Managers Off the Hook
